Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Adventure bikers in for a treat, govt lo.description: Vijayawada: It’s happy time for motorcycling aficionados in the city as the Andhra Pradesh tourism authority (APTA) has started building up necessary infrastructure across popular destinations in the state. In recent times, bike tours have become a real crowd favourite in the state. City biker Ravi Kumar, who regularly takes up long trips on his bike, speaks of some popular destinations of city bikers. While several riders take up trips to Araku valley, some niche ridersbike down to Maredumilli in Chittoor district. “Bike tourism is not only about the destination. It’s mostly about the journey. The routes, therefore, needs to be selected carefully if one wants the trip to be memorable,” Kumar told TOI. The culture and heritage of Andhra Pradesh, bikers say, is the experience tourists get attracted to. From stupas to forts, AP’s culture showcases are diverse and give ample tourism opportunities. APTA is taking steps to promote adventure bike rides in possible tourism locations like Araku Valley, Maredumilli, Konaseema, Gandikota and Horsley Hills. These locations have great possibilities to promote motorbike tours and the best possible months for bike tourism is from September to March. Speaking to TOI, chief marketing officer (CMO) of APTA M Srinivas Rao acknowledges that infrastructure still needs to be developed to aid bike tourists. “However, we have sufficient accomodations in destinations like Araku, Dindi in Konaseema and Maredumilli. The best route in AP for a bike tour would be from Maredumilli till Araku, if one wants to experience both scenic beauty as well as adventure,” Rao said. Officials go on to say that many make a trip from Chennai to Tada falls, Pulicat Lake and Sriharikota region. From Karnataka, trips to Gandikota, also known as the “hidden grand canyon of India”, are taken up. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Andhra Pradesh chief minister\u2019s con.description: VIJAYAWADA: Security officers of the Andhra Pradesh chief minister have said that they will be making some changes in YS Jaganmohan Reddy’s convoy vehicles. Sources said that around six new black Toyota Fortuner vehicles bearing a registration number AP 39 PA 2345 will line-up for the new chief minister. The old batch of vehicles has been sent to Hyderabad while the new convoy is being set up. Jaganmohan Reddy’s uncle and former YSR Congress MP YV Subba Reddy inspected the chief ministers chambers at the secretariat, the cabinet hall, the helipad and the convoy. A discussion also took place between the officials who made some suggestions. Jaganmohan Reddy’s number plate design will also undergo a change. Though Jaganmohan enjoys Z+ category security, similar to his predecessor N Chandrababu Naidu, security measures were further upgraded during the election campaign. Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy to v.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy will visit the Polavaram Project site on June 20. The CM is likely to hold a review meeting at the project site with officials and the contractor to have an on-the-spot assessment of the project. He may also review financial aspects of the project, land acquisition, rehabilitation and resettlement, money paid to contractors and funds received from the central government. The CM is planning to request the central government to take over construction. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

9-year-old dies in road accident in Tiru.description: TIRUPATI: A 9-year-old boy on pilgrimage with his family was killed in a road accident when the driver of an SUV lost complete control of the vehicle and hit the devotees. The deceased has been identified as Loka Prasad. According to Tirumala police, the nine-year-old and his family had arrived at Tirumala on pilgrimage. As the family exited the pilgrim’s amentities complex I and were walking down the road near Kalyani rest house, an SUV came and struct them. The child died on the spot. Other devotees too sustained severe injuries. The Tirumala police have registered a case against the driver who reportedly had a fit and lost control of the vehicle. Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Two youths drown in West Kukkuleru drain.description: ELURU: Two youths drowned at the West Kukkuleru drain at Modi village in Mogalthuru mandal on Monday evening. The bodies were later fished out by the police. According to the police, a local festival celebrating the village deity Settibalija Mutyalamma was being held at the Perupalem north village on Monday morning. Hundreds of villagers had gathered to offer prayers to the deity. After the ‘jatara’ (local festival), the villagers too the deity’s idol to immerse it in the West Kukkuleru drain (also known as Uppeteru). Around 10 youths had gathered for the immersion ceremony. 18-year-old Kavuru Suresh, a resident of Parupalem north village and 20-year-old Donga Ramesh, resident of Mutayapalli village ventured into the water to take a dip. However, soon after both the youths drowned in the water and were washed away. The others gathered immediately informed the police and began a search for the missing youths. Police, revenue and fire officials reached the spot and after a lot of effort, managed to retrieve the bodies. The Mogalthuru police have registered a case. Maharashtra Lok Sabha Constituencies.description: MUMBAI: Maharashtra, which has 48 parliamentary constituencies, will go to polls in four phases, starting April 11. In 2009 and 2014, Lok Sabha elections were held in three phases in Maharashtra On April 11, seven constituencies in Maharashtra’s Vidarbha region will go to polls - Nagpur, Wardha, Yavatmal-Washim, and the naxal-affected areas of Gadchiroli and Chandrapur. In the second phase on April 18, 10 constituencies - including three constituencies in Vidarbha, six in Marathwada and Solapur in western Maharashtra - go to elections. The third phase, on April 23, of polling will be held in Pune, Baramati, Jalgaon, Jalna, Aurangabad, Raigad and Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg, Sangli, Satara and Kolhapur. In the final phase on April 29, all six constituencies in Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Palghar and Bhiwandi will go to polls among the total 17 seats in the state. KEY CONSTITUENCIESAmong the key constituencies are Baramati and Nagpur featuring high-profile candidates such as Supriya Sule and Nitin Gadkari. Then there is Ahmednagar from where Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, is contesting. Other important constituencies are Jalna, Chandrapur, Dhule, Beed, Sangli, Mumbai North Central, Mumbai North and Baramati.    CONSTITUENCIES CONTENDERS   Chandrapur Union MoS Hansraj Ahir (BJP); Suresh Dhanorkar (Congress)   Baramati Kanchan Kul (BJP); Supriya Sule (Congress)   Jalna State BJP chief Raosaheb Danve BJP; Vilas Keshavrao Autade (Congress)   Akola Sanjay Dhotre (BJP); Hidayat Patel (Congress)   Bhiwandi Kapil Patil(BJP); Suresh Kashinath Taware (Congress)    Nagpur Union minister Nitin Gadkari (BJP)   Ahmednagar Sujay Vikhe Patil (BJP)   Dhule Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre (BJP)    Beed Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter Pritam (BJP); Bajrang Sonawane (NCP)   Sangli Sitting MP Sanjay Patil (BJP)    Mumbai North Central Poonam Mahajan (BJP)    Aurangabad Subhash Zambad (Congress)   Gadchiroli Ashok Nete (BJP)   Mumbai North Gopal Shetty (BJP)    Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

AP assembly passes unanimous resolution.description: VIJAYAWADA: The AP assembly unanimously passed a resolution on Tuesday, seeking special category status for the state. The House appealed to the NDA government at the Centre to grant SCS to the state at the earliest to overcome the financial crisis following its bifurcation. Chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy moved the resolution, giving some background on the bifurcation of the state, distribution of assets and liabilities, and the promises made to the state by the Parliament as a precondition to the bifurcation and the constitutional binding of the government to fulfil the bifurcation promises, including the SCS. He sought to blame the previous TDP government for not pursuing the issue in 2014, till the Planning Commission was replaced with Niti Aayog. “The SCS promise was made to the state on the floor of Rajya Sabha and the same was ratified by the cabinet, which was again sent to the Planning Commission for implementation. However, the TDP government, instead of asking the Planning Commission to implement it, asked the central government, which brought the issue back to the table of the Union council of ministers,” the CM said. Jagan further said that the bifurcation was unjust, as distribution of assets and liabilities was not done in proportion. He also emphasised on the need to develop the state, which can be achieved if it gets SCS. “The grant of special category status will help the state get special industrial incentives such as income tax exemption, exemptions pertaining to GST, besides other concessions. The assembly reiterates that such special incentives are vital for our agrarian state, as it would enable rapid industrialisation, which would lead to improved employment opportunities for the youth and overall development of the state,” the resolution stated, adding that “the assembly expresses its firm opinion that there are no impediments whatsoever to conferring SCS on Andhra Pradesh”. Cold storage fire: Crops, property of Rs.description: TIRUPATI: Crops and property worth more than Rs 3 crore were destroyed after a fire broke out at a private cold storage unit near Bollavaram village of Kurnool district on Tuesday. According to district fire officer G Srinivasa Reddy, the fire was spotted at Srichakra cold storage unit at around 5am. “Gas leakage and short circuit is likely to have triggered the fire,” he said. The watchman on duty spotted the fire and immediately alerted his bosses, who in turn informed the local fire services department. It took four fire tenders four long hours to bring the raging fire under control. By then, the damage was done. Agricultural produce including paddy, red gram and dried chilli, besides property was completely gutted. No casualties, however, were reported. The fire officer said a case has been registered and investigation is on to ascertain the cause of the fire. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Naidu skips \u2018one-nation, one-electi.description: Amaravati: Stating that the one-nation, one-election concept is a very serious and sensitive issue, TDP supremo and former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday advised the Centre to continue its deliberation with constitutional experts, legal luminaries and wide cross-section of the society before arriving at a decision. Naidu, an invitee to the all-party meeting chaired by Prime Minister Narendra Modi in New Delhi on Wednesday, skipped the session due to personal reasons. He, however, dashed off a letter to Union parliamentary affairs minister Prahlad Joshi to put forward his party’s stand on the issue. Naidu said a lot of thought was given before accepting parliamentary democracy while formulating the Indian constitution. “Decoupling the assembly and parliament elections was done to protect cooperative federalism. The one-nation, one-election is an amalgamation of legal, political and practical aspects. I expect all parties would weigh the nation’s good and participate in consultations,” said Naidu in the letter. He also requested the Centre to ensure that India is free of communalism, casteism, terrorism, corruption, crony capitalism and nepotism by 2022 when the country hosts the G-20 meeting. “A collective will of people is required to build a new India,” Naidu observed, adding that the need of the hour is to address distress in farming sector, create employment opportunities, build infrastructure, focus on women empowerment and gender equity to bring in equality between different sections of the society. “Creating an environment of sustainable development for future generations is also important to see a new India in the next three years.” Naidu also urged the Centre to line up different programmes to commemorate the 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi, and promised to participate in such programmes. “Gandhi is the most influential Indian of the 20th century, whose shadow continues to loom large over the country,” he observed. He also urged the parliamentary affairs minister to chalk out ways to improve the business of parliament. “Strengthening the committee system could go a long way in improving the quality of laws drafted and minimize potential implementation charges,” Naidu said in the letter. Prove irrigation project irregularities,.description: VIJAYAWADA: TDP questioned the new government’s priorities in the assembly on Monday. The opposition party alleged that the governor’s speech did not include key topics such as Amaravati development, Polavaram Project and industrial policy. Both Houses of the legislature have begun the debate on the motion thanking governor ESL Narasimhan for his address on June 14. In the assembly, government whip Budi Mutyala Naidu moved the motion, seconded by Kakani Govardhan Reddy. They said the government headed by Y S Jaganmohan Reddy is giving priority to neglected sections and farmers. They accused the TDP government of indulging in heavy corruption in Polavaram Project and Pattiseema lift irrigation scheme. TDP leader K Atchannaidu found fault with the governor not acknowledging development in the last five years. He questioned the government for not making any mention of Amaravati and Polavaram Project. He welcomed the ruling party’s decision to order probe into irrigation projects and asked them to prove the charges. He dared them to stop Pattiseema scheme, if YSRC found it useless as some members claimed. “If you think Pattiseema is a wasteful project, I would advise you to stop pumping water from the scheme for this season and see what the farmers would say,” Atchannaidu said. He found fault with the government handing over some buildings of AP to Telangana, without settling the institutions listed in Schedule IX and X of the AP Reorganisation Act. He also wanted the government to check with the energy department and ensure there are no power cuts in the state. Finance minister Buggana Rajendranath Reddy blamed the TDP government for not getting funds from the central government or get Schedule IX and X institutions bifurcated in the last four years when the TDP was in alliance with BJP. On developmental issues, the minister said the TDP government had utilised the spillover funds from the 13th finance commission, full funds from the 14th finance commission and funds from MNREGS. “Whatever was spent from these funds had gone mostly to Janma Bhoomi committees ignoring the elected gram panchayat sarpanches and ward members,” the minister said. Telugu family of 4 found dead in US.description: Vijayawada: Mystery shrouds the death of four members of a Telugu family who were shot and killed at their home in West Des Moines city, Iowa in the US on Saturday. Sunkara Chandrasekhar, 44, his wife Lavanya, 41, and their two sons aged 15 and 10, were shot and killed, a police statement said. The family was originally from Tsundur town in Andhra Pradesh’s Guntur district and were living in the US for at least the past two decades. On Saturday at around 10 am, a local resident contacted the emergency number 911 after being informed about gun shots being heard in Chandrasekhar’s house. Police officials, who rushed to the spot, found the four lying dead with gunshot wounds. Sources close to the family said that they had moved into the house only in March. Speaking to TOI, a family friend who is also a member of Telugu Association of North America (TANA) said on condition of anonymity that Chandrasekhar has been suffering from depression for a while and that there might have been a dispute in the family. In an Instagram post, local police explained that at the time of the shooting, other family members, including two adults and two children, were living in the house as guests. After discovering the bodies, one of them rushed out looking for help. He found someone who then called up 911. The police have not revealed the identity of the guests. Although the police have not given any details about the motive behind the shooting, they have stated that there is no immediate threat to the community and that the deaths directly affect their family friends and co-workers. They have also said that investigations had revealed that at the time of the gun being fired, no outsider had entered the house. This is being interpreted by many that a family dispute may be behind the deaths. Chandrasekhar worked for the Iowa department of public safety’s technology services bureau. Sources added that Lavanya too was a software developer. Friends and acquaintances cited his work excellence certificates claiming that he was hard working employee. TANA members got in touch with family members in Tsundur town and were told that everyone was in a state of shock. They also rejected any help saying that they did not want any attention. AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tree crushes 6-year-old in Tenali school.description: Vijayawada: A six-year-old boy died after a tree fell on him inside his school premises. The incident took place at Marichupet in Tenali on Wednesday. The deceased was identified as Bhimavarapu Sandeep Reddy, a class one student at the government municipal primary school. After school hours, Sandeep was waiting for his elder brother to leave for home when the eucalyptus tree under which he was standing collapsed, crushing him. He was taken to Tenali government hospital but the doctors declared him brought dead. However, no physical injuries other than a fractured leg were there on his body. Tenali three town inspector B Harikrishna said that doctors were suspecting internal injuries and shock might have caused the boy’s death. A case under Section 174 of CrPC has been registered by the cops. The inspector went on to say that the trunk of the tree was rendered weak by insects and the accident could take place at any time. Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Andhra Pradesh becomes first in India to.description: VIJAYAWADA: The Andhra Pradesh police department has become the first in the country to give weekly offs to its personnel. From Wednesday itself, all personnel from constable to inspector ranks will start getting offs. Director general of police (DGP) Gautam Sawang ordered this after a meeting with the committee constituted to formulate guidelines on weekly offs. This comes in spite of the fact that the police department is facing a severe staff crunch. There is about 20% staff shortage in the department. The committee, headed by additional director general of police Ravishankar Ayyannar, gave its report with 19 alternative plans that will fit various units like intelligence, CID, SPF and greyhounds. The unit heads can choose any plan depending upon their convenience, said Ayyannar. While some states have earlier tried to implement weekly offs, they have been limited to pilot projects only. With implementation of weekly offs, cumulative staff crunch in the department will be 30 per cent as one-seventh of the staff will be off duties. Ayyannar went on to say that an IT dashboard will be created to monitor the weekly offs in all districts and special units from the DGP’s office. The system will be reviewed after a month to deal with the problems that arise in implementation. Police officers’ associations across the state welcomed the decision. Srinivasa Rao, president of Andhra Pradesh police officers’ association thanked chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy and the DGP for implementing the weekly offs. He said that they have been waiting for this for two decades. Jaganmohan Reddy had made weekly offs to police personnel a part of his election promises. Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. Read this story in MarathiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

'Blade-batch' gang attacks 70-year-old w.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 70-year-old woman was allegedly attacked by unidentified miscreants suspected to be a part of the notorious blade batch near Vijayawada Railway Station on late Tuesday night. According to railway police, the woman who sells dry fish was found by the railway sanitary workers on the tracks where she was walking with ripped clothes. Initially, it was assumed that she might be raped but later cops ascertained that she was only assaulted by the blades on her hands, chest and private parts. Cops said the miscreants stole around Rs 300 from her. The woman who is a native of Vuyyur mandal in Krishna district sells fish to make ends meet. According to the victim’s statement, she claimed that the miscreants were inebriated and cops suspect that they might have been under the influence of ganja. GRP CI Ratna Raju and his team reached the spot and shifted to Vijayawada government hospital where she received treatment. Cops assured that they would nab the accused and have put out teams to hunt the miscreants. They are also looking into the CCTV to identify the miscreants while they fled towards the railway station. They also took six suspects into custody and are interrogating them. Further investigation is still on. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Uttar Pradesh.description: "You're sitting on my grand mother's grave," Salim Shah told this correspondent. She has been buried, he said, in his living room. A clutch of houses in Chah Pokhar in Achnera block of Agra have turned into graveyards as families are forced to bury their departed in their homes due to lack of a burial ground. As a result, the dead here are a constant part of day-to-day life. TOI found women cooking next to where their children were buried while the elderly rested on cots in a backyard full of graves. In one of the houses, Rinki Begum told TOI that five bodies were buried in her backyard, including that of her 10-month-old son who had died of an untreated fever. Another resident, Guddi, said, "For poor people like us, there is no dignity in death. Due to lack of space in houses, people have to sit and walk over graves. It is so disrespectful." Almost all the houses in the block have graves within the compound Most of the Muslim families here are poor and landless and men scout for work as contract labourers. They said their demand for a graveyard has been ignored for years. The pond in Chah Pokhar village, where a piece of land is allocated for the burial ground on papersThe apathy of the administration can be gauged from the fact that a plot allotted for a graveyard some years ago falls right in the middle of a pond. Repeated complaints have fallen on deaf ears and residents are running out of space. The fresh graves are no more cemented to ensure they occupy less space and stones of different sizes kept over them are the only way to tell them apart. Protests have erupted in the past over the issue. In 2017, after the death of resident Mangal Khan, his family refused to bury his body until land for a graveyard was provided in the village. After assurances by the authorities, they buried Khan near the pond. But the promises came to nothing. Living with the dead: A grave in the backyard"All we are asking for is some land for our ancestors. There is a cremation ground for the Hindus in the periphery of the village, but we are living with our dead," said Munim Khan, a factory worker. Desperate residents even tried reaching out to nearby Sanan village and Achnera town that have burial grounds. But they were not willing to part with precious space. "These two villages have a larger Muslim population than Chah Pokhar. Their burial grounds are filled to capacity," said Nizam Khan, a mechanic. Village pradhan Sundar Kumar said that he had asked officials several times for a burial ground for Muslim families, but no action was taken. Ravi Kumar NG, the district magistrate, said that he was not aware of the issue. "I will send an official team to the village and get details of the burial land required." Picture Credit: Hemant Kumar In Video:Houses turn into graveyards as Muslims in this UP village bury the dead at homeDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy to.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy has accepted his Telangana counterpart K Chandrasekhar Rao’s invitation to attend the inauguration of the Kaleswaram Project on June 21. On Monday, KCR met Jaganmohan Reddy at the latter’s Tadepalli residence to invite him. The two chief ministers discussed issues like inter-state river water, irrigation projects on Krishna and Godavari rivers, distribution of the institutions in the Schedule IX and X of the AP Reorganisation Act apart from other issues concerning both states. It is said that the two chief ministers have agreed to solve problems related to sharing of Krishna and Godavari waters and the projects proposed by the two states on the rivers without going to river water dispute tribunals. The chief ministers have decided to convene a meeting of chief secretaries of AP and Telangana on June 24. The secretaries, engineers and other senior officials of the water resources department would also be present in this meeting to resolve the inter-state water issues. Sources said KCR and Jagan had an initial talk about taking up a combined lift irrigation project on the Godavari to pump water into Nagarjuna Sagar reservoir. This would help both states to share the Godavari water from this reservoir. The Kaleswaram Project will benefit Guntur and Prakasam districts through Nagarjuna Sagar right canal. The CMs also spoke about taking up a combined lift irrigation project. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Retailers continue to flout court order.description: Vijayawada: Even though the Supreme Court and the state consumer forum had issued orders against the sale of branded plastic bags, the practice goes on unabated across Vijayawada. From supermarkets to major wholesale dealers, vendors have been charging between Rs 10 and Rs 25 for branded plastic or cloth bags. According to the judgement of the consumer forum last year, plastic bags can be sold only if they are not branded. The local municipal body was empowered to implement the order. The body was given the authority to impose fines ranging from Rs 9,000 to Rs 18,000. “Recently, one of the Decathelon showrooms in Hyderabad was fined for selling branded carry bags. Prior to that, a Bata showroom in Chandigarh was held for contempt of court for a similar issue,” said Harish Shekhawat, a city-based consumer activist. Officials of the Vijayawada Municipal Corporation (VMC) said that they are first focussing on weeding out harmful plastic bags and will subsequently focus on the issue. Shekhawat further said that consumers blindly shell out money for carry bags exhibiting the brand name, without the awareness that the brand logo entitles them to get it for free. Many major retailers continue to violate the law as they would rather be fined once than lose a major source of income from customers. In their defence, retailers say that manufacturing these bags cost much more than disposable bags and they have already laid out a suggestive notice to bring their own bags. The public can keep the bill where they have been charged for branded carry bags and lodge a complaint through the Meekosam mobile application. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. YSRC, TDP trade charges over corruption.description: VIJAYAWADA: YSRC and TDP members traded charges against each other on core issues of development, welfare and corruption in the assembly on Monday. The debate on the motion of thanks to the governor’s speech seems to have given enough opportunity for YSRC to blame the previous government for neglecting welfare. YSRC MLAs G Srikanth Reddy, Kakani Govardhan Reddy, Ambati Rambabu, R K Roja and Jogi Ramesh blamed the TDP for indulging in heavy corruption and resorting to wasteful expenditure. They blamed TDP for not fulfilling the promise of loan waiver for farmers. They alleged corruption in Polavaram project, Amaravati land pooling and other issues. TDP MLAs K Atchannaidu and Gorantla Butchaiah Chowdary dared YSRC to prove their allegations. “You have been making these allegations for the fast five years sitting in the opposition. Now, sitting in the treasury benches, you are making the same allegations. If you are serious on this, who is stopping you from ordering probe and coming up with facts?” Atchannaidu asked. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Vijayawada 78th most polluted in world,.description: VIJAYAWADA: Vijayawada is the 78th most polluted city in the world and 55th most polluted city in the continent, according to a pollution survey. In last five years, Vijayawada’s pollution score has worsened from 63 to 72 in the global pollution index. While the city does not outrank metros like Chennai, Bengaluru, Mumbai or Delhi, it stands at the sixth place among two-tier cities in the country. In 2014, Vijayawada stood at 111th place in the pollution index. While the city is certainly not as polluted as Delhi, its pollution level is ranked ‘extremely high’. However, Vijayawada has a lesser greenery in comparison with Delhi. The global pollution index publishes its findings on a real-time basis based upon scores given by residents of a particular city. Apart from air quality, residents of Vijayawada gave the city the lowest scores in garbage disposal systems and general comfort. Vijayawada is worse off than Visakhapatnam which achieved a score of 68.01 and was ranked 106th globally. Other two-tier cities which have ranked better than Vijayawada include Pune, Ahmedabad, Dehradun, Madurai, Thane, Nagpur, Vadodara, Coimbatore and Indore. The least polluted two-tier city in India is Mangalore which secured the 263rd place in the global pollution index. The Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) had recently announced that all five major cities of the state— Vijayawada, Visakhapatnam, Guntur, Kurnool and Nellore are ‘non-attainment areas’ and fall short of ambient air quality standards according to Ambient Air Quality India (2011-15) and WHO. Experts opine that burning of garbage, construction-related activities and increase in vehicular pollution in Vijayawada, after Amaravati was declared the state capital, has led to the increase in PM-10 levels. The pollution survey was done by Numbeo.com. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Curse of women led to TDP\u2019s downfal.description: VIJAYAWADA: YSR Congress MLA R K Roja, speaking during the motion of thanks to the governor in the assembly on Monday, said women of the state “cursed the TDP” in the elections, which reduced their strength to just 23 in the 175-member AP assembly. “The TDP did not show any respect for women during its five-year rule,” Roja said, adding that a woman officer was dragged by her hair in the sand by a TDP leader, who was among those defeated in the elections. “Some MLAs were involved in the call money sex racket where women were forced to provide sexual favours. Those MLAs have been defeated too. The former speaker of this assembly had said that cars should be parked in sheds and women should be confined to their homes. The speaker lost and was chased out of the polling booth during the elections,” she recalled. Roja said the TDP government had promised loan waiver to women of self-help groups but it was not fulfilled. “The women were forced to repay loans with more interest and were declared defaulters by banks,” she said, adding that those women played a big role in TDP’s humiliating defeat. “I was insulted on the floor of this House. I was suspended from the House for one year and they did not revoke the suspension even after the Supreme Court’s order. The women of the state saw all this and showed you the place where you are now.” She praised CM Jaganmohan Reddy, who has given greater share to women in the cabinet. “An ST woman has been made the deputy chief minister, while an SC woman is the state’s home minister,” Roja added. Jagan attends all-party meet, backs PM\u.description: VIJAYAWADA: Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy joined the all-party meeting convened by Prime Minister Narendra Modi to discuss the concept of ‘one nation, one election’, in the national capital on Wednesday. Though some opposition parties, including the Congress and its allies in the UPA, boycotted the meeting, YSR Congress from AP and TRS from Telangana attended the meeting. While Jagan represented YSRC, K T Rama Rao represented the TRS as its working president, as party president and chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao is busy monitoring arrangements for the inauguration of the Kaleswaram project in his state on June 21. Sources said Jagan responded positively to the concept of joint elections for Parliament and state assemblies proposed by the PM. However, it was decided to form an expert committee to study the proposal. PM Modi will pick the names for the committee, and sources indicate that a YSRC nominee would find a place in the panel. The issue has been raised by the PM to cut down on expenditure in the elections, besides avoiding polls in one state or the other in the country at varying intervals. Jagan also welcomed the proposals to celebrate the 150th birth anniversary of Mahatma Gandhi and 75 years of Independence in the coming years. The YSR Congress would be a part of these celebrations which would be organized by the central government. On the occasion, the chief minister requested the Centre to increase central funds for backward districts of the state. The chief minister sought to draw the attention of the Prime Minister that the four Rayalaseema and three north Andhra districts were promised special package at the time of bifurcation. However, these districts were not given their due funds as promised in the last five years, and appealed to the PM to release the funds. YSRC, which has 22 MPs in the Lok Sabha, has agreed to cooperate with the government in the healthy functioning of the Parliament. Meanwhile, on his arrive in the national capital, Jagan travelled by Delhi metro from the airport to the Parliament house, where the meeting was convened. He was accompanied by senior officials and party MPs. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman burns lover, cousin alive.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 50-year-old woman was burnt alive by her cousin at Sanathnagar on Wednesday morning. An autorickshaw driver Khaleel too suffered severe burn injuries in the incident and succumbed late in the evening. The deceased woman was identified as Hajinissa. Khaleel was Hajinissa’s brother. According to Penamaluru inspector V Peddiraju, the 50-year-old accused Nafeesa (name changed) had been in an alleged extra-marital affair with her brother-in-law Khaleel for five years. Over the years, Nafeesa grew jealous of Khaleel’s wife and decided to kill her. The incident took place around 9am after Nafeesa’s husband Karim left for work. Nafeesa then walked into Khaleel’s room and found him sleeping next to a woman whom she assumed to be his wife. However, it was Hajnissa who was sleeping next to Khaleel. Nafeesa doused Hajinissa with petrol and set her ablaze. In the process, Khaleel, too, suffered heavy burn injuries Investigation revealed that Nafeesa was angry that Khaleel had been avoiding her in the recent past and decided to take the extreme measure. “In order to avoid any family disputes, Khaleel had been distancing himself from Nafeesa,” Peddiraju told TOI.  Khaleel was taken to Vijayawada government general hospital (GGH) where he died around 8.30pm. A case under section 302 of IPC (murder) was registered against Nafeesa. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Easy redressal: Fire attendance docus no.description: Vijayawada: City residents will now have an easier deal while applying for insurance after a fire accident. An online service to issue fire attendance certificate to the public was launched at the headquarters of the state disaster response and fire services department on Wendesday. The fire attendance certificate is necessary to claim insurance funds after a fire. Principal secretary of home KRM Kishore Kumar inaugurated the service. Addressing the media at the event, director general of fire services K Satyanarayana explained that earlier, people had to fill up applications manually to get the attendance certificates, which was a cumbersome process. “Now, anyone can sit at their home and use their computers to apply for the fire attendance certificate online, download and print the copy of the system-generated fire attendance certificate,” Satyanarayana said. Not just holders of residential properties, even those of industries can apply for the certificate online. The no-objection certificates are already available online. “Digitisation would automatically reduce corruption in the department as officials won’t have much of an interactive role with the applicants,” Satyanarayana said. Explaining other upcoming upgrades to the department, Satyanarayana explained that more fire stations are being constructed and the much-awaited fire station office has already been constructed in Visakhapatnam, ready to be inaugurated soon by the home minister. He also said that a district fire office in Kakinada is coming up. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. NIA opposes bail to Jagan attacker, move.description: Vijayawada: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) moved the high court on Wednesday against the granting of bail to J Srinivasa Rao, the accused in the attack on chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy at Visakhapatnam airport last year. The NIA has challenged the decision of the special NIA court, which granted bail to Srinivasa Rao recently. The NIA argued that the special court, while granting bail to Srinivasa Rao, did not give any reasons. The Suppression of Unlawful Acts against Safety of Civil Aviation Act mandates to give reasons while granting bail to the accused, according to section 6A of the Act. However, the NIA court did not consider this while granting bail to the accused, the NIA stated in its plea, while adding that though a charge sheet has been filed, their investigation is yet to be completed. Giving bail to the accused while the investigation is underway could hamper its progress, argued Sidda Ramulu, the NIA counsel. Countering the argument, Matta Jayakar, the counsel for Srinivas Rao, said the accused is not a terrorist or extremist. He further argued that no one knows exactly what happened on that day as no CCTV footage is available. Also, the NIA has stated in the lower court that they are filing a final charge sheet. As it has also been filed, there is no reason to reject bail to the accused, he argued. However, the high court bench headed by chief justice C Praveen Kumar asked Jayakar’s stand on section 6A, to which he sought one week’s time. Accepting his request, the high court posted the matter to be heard again on June 26. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

K Raghupathi elected deputy speaker.description: VIJAYAWADA: The assembly unanimously elected Bapatla MLA Kona Raghupathi as deputy speaker on Tuesday. He is a second-time legislator from the ruling YSRC. His candidature was supported by ministers Peddireddi Ramachandra Reddy, Botsa Satyanarayana, Mekathoti Sucharitha, Kodali Srivenkateswara Rao and others. Chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy and leader of opposition N Chandrababu Naidu, besides others accompanied Raghupathi to the speaker’s chair as speaker Thammineni Sitharam welcomed his new deputy. Ministers and members of the Assembly greeted the new deputy speaker on his  and expressed confidence that he would run the House successfully and impartially like his father, the late Kona Prabhakara Rao, who served as speaker in 1980-81. He was elected to the assembly from Bapatla constituency for three consecutive terms from 1967. Kona Prabhakara Rao was a minister in the Bhavanam Venkatram and Kotla Vijayabhaskara Reddy’s governments. Later, he served as governor of Pondicherry, Sikkim and Maharashtra. Kona Raghupathi entered politics in 2014 and elected to the Assembly on an YSRC ticket. He remained with YSRC though there were pressures from the then ruling TDP to switchover. Jaganmohan Reddy has rewarded Raghupathi’s loyalty with the deputy speaker post. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PCA could be answer for a city facing wa.description: Visakhapatnam: With the city facing a water crisis every year, adopting water-saving technology and making sustainable use of water is becoming increasingly important. One of the techniques, which seems to be gaining in popularity in the city is the use of Pressure Compensating Aerator (PCA). While people residing in areas like Kirlampudi layout, Siripuram, have already adopted the technology, the Greater Visakhapatnam Municipal Corporation has also adopted the same. Apart from a few private companies, hospitals and hotels in the city, the Navy house and naval quarters have also come forward to use the technology. Speaking to TOI, GVMC commissioner, M Hari Narayanan, said, “We have adopted this technology in the GVMC building and it is a good initiative towards sustainable use of water. Small drops make an ocean; hence this initiative will go a long way in the future.” Similarly, Uday Shirname, president of Kirlampudi Layout RWA and AP Federation of RWAs, said, “We have installed the water nozzles with this technology in all the main water points in every flat of our building and the result is surprising. 40%-50% of the water can be saved without compromising on the comfort level. Other buildings in my colony have also followed the same. The nozzles are cheap and easy to install.” Speaking about the technology’s effectiveness, the business head of a private company, which sells the product said “Unlike countries like Singapore, there is no regulatory mechanism to control pressure of water in the country. Hence, a lot of water goes waste. “The water discharge in Litres Per Minute (LPM) while washing hands is around 9-12 LPM. But the PCA technology helps in saving 80% water as it comes down to 2 LPM. Similarly, the LPM for showerheads is 20-25 LPM but if the technology is adopted, the LPM reduces it to nine. Depending on the usage of water every minute, more than 50% of water can be saved in every household and office.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Mother, paramour jailed for forcing mino.description: VIJAYAWADA: A woman from Ongole got a four-year jail term for forcing her minor daughter into prostitution. The woman’s paramour, who had raped the girl multiple times, was sentenced to ten years imprisonment. Organisers of one prostitution house was sentenced to ten years and those of another house were jailed for seven years. The woman, mother of a 13-year-old girl, had started living with an auto driver after she separated from her husband. The paramour raped the girl multiple times and even as the girl informed her mother about the abuse, the latter did not pay any heed. Later, the woman and the paramour sold the girl to a prostitution house in Vijayawada for Rs 2 lakh. After a few days, the organisers at Vijayawada sent the girl to another house at Mangalagiri in Guntur. Later, she was shifted to Chirala. While the girl was being shifted to Chilakaluripe, the vehicle met with an accident and she managed to escape and reach the cops. Since the mother was one of the accused, the girl was pressured by her relatives not to give a statement. However, then deputy superintendent of police Prem Kajal took it upon himself to counsel the girl and book cases against all involved. An Ongole special court that deals with POCSO cases convicted the accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Vijayawada: Man burnt alive in fire mish.description: VIJAYAWADA: A 60-year-old man was charred to death in a fire mishap at Kammenamola village of Nagayalanka mandal in Krishna district during the wee hours of Thursday. The deceased was identified as L Gopala Swamy. According to District Fire Officer (DFO) D Niranjan Reddy, the blaze started around 2.30am due to a suspected short circuit in the village. As many as eight hutments were gutted in the mishap. The victim, who was sleeping inside one of the huts, could not escape and was burnt alive. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Will revamp Arogya Sri scheme, says Nani.description: Amaravati: Deputy chief minister in-charge of medical and health ministry, Alla Kalikrishna Srinivas (Nani) assumed charge at the secretariat on Monday. Speaking on the occasion, Nani said that making Andhra Pradesh a healthy state is as the top of the state government’s agenda. The deputy chief minister further said that the ‘Arogya Sri’ scheme will be completely revamped to help people. Every disease whose treatment costs more than Rs 1,000 will be included in the Arogya Sri package, he said. Addressing the media, Nani said that the TDP government had grossly neglected the scheme, causing suffering to the common people. He further alleged that the TDP government did not even clear the bills to hospitals, prompting them to refuse patients. “CM YS Jaganmohan Reddy was extremely pained at the death of infants in a government hospital in Ananthapuram. The incident was a result of the neglect of the TDP government,” the deputy chief minister said. Nani added that they have inspected the Ananthapuram hospital and would soon submit a report to the CM. Nani alleged that the TDP government had done nothing to improve health services except changing the name of the scheme to NTR Arogya Seva. Interestingly, the first file that the minister signed was to change the name of the scheme to YSR Arogya Sri. Nani assured that the government would soon begin the disbursement of Rs 10,000 pension to kidney patients. Meanwhile, women and child welfare minister Taneti Vanitha who also took charge as the secretariat on Sunday said and said that the CM has directed officials to not spare anyone indulging in crimes against women and children. The minister also cleared a file pertaining to increase of wages to Anganwadi workers. tnn Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. The counting of votes will take place on May 23. | Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesThe four-cornered contest for the 39 Lok Sabha seats features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. Naidu, family take week-long European br.description: Amaravati: Former chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu, who skipped the all-party meet in New Delhi, went on an European holiday along with his family on Wednesday. Naidu, his wife Bhuvaneswari, son Lokesh, son-in-law Brahmani and grandson Devansh took the flight from the Rajiv Gandhi international airport in Hyderabad. However, no details were available on which nations Naidu will tour during the week-long trip. Though the TDP chief wanted to take the break after his party’s election debacle, he postponed the trip in view of the assembly session. After the session got over, his family reached Hyderabad late on Tuesday night and took the flight to Europe on Wednesday. The TDP chief, who rarely goes holidaying, was persuaded by son Lokesh to take a break from regular political activity and spend time with the family. His last overseas trip with family members was in 2015, when he visited Turkey. In the last three years, he didn’t take a break due to hectic government and party activities.
